preamble: In this section you will describe hardware choices such as model of amplifier, cap and electrodes used in the study, triggers and additional devices used.  NOTE: If you notice a bug, or have a suggestion, we'd be grateful if you posted an issue on GitHub: https://github.com/INCF/artem-is/
question: How were the EEG electrodes placed?
Cap or net make (brand)
Cap or net make (brand) other than listed above
Cap or net model
Make (brand) of the electrodes
details: This is often, but not necessarily so, the same brand as the cap, if they were purchased together as a set.

question: Model of electrodes
Did electrodes have pre-amplifiers?
What material were electrodes made of?
Specify the material that the electrodes were made of.
Type of conductive medium used other than listed.
choices: conductive gel | saline solution | adhesive paste | none (dry electrodes) | other

question: Conductive medium type other than listed.
Were all electrode slots available in the cap used (i.e., they had electrodes in them)?
What type of placement convention is appropriate for describing electrode placement scheme in this study?
choices: International 10-20 system and its extensions (e.g., 10-10, 5 percent) | an equidistant electrode placement scheme | other | custom locations
Change_log: 7.9.2023 Angela: "other placement systems" replaced with "other" in case it may help future automatization of "other" options

question: Which extension of the 10-20 system will you use to describe electrode positions?
details: We recommend selecting the 5% convention (Oostenveld & Praamstra, 2001) as it is the latest version.

question: Number of EEG electrodes that were used for acquisition (including, if they are on scalp, ground and reference electrodes, as well as earlobes; excluding EOG and other non-EEG electrodes).
details: This should not include empty slots on the cap where electrodes were not placed, if there were such slots.

question: The appropriate methods description should also include a list or a scheme of all electrode locations. A convenient way to do this is currently not available in ARTEM-IS due to technical limitations, so please provide either a list of all electrodes, or a link where the sceheme/list can be found.
details: The link can be to a public preregistration document, OSF file, preprint, or a publication. Ideally, the link should not be to an address that you expect to change in the future.
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: Instructions changed - I added the option to list electrodes here in addition to the earlier only option to provide a link to an external location.

question: Were there any electrodes other than scalp electrodes and mastoids/earlobes?
details: For example: nose electrode or EOG
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: I made the next question optional by adding this question

question: Which other electrodes were used for recording?
choices: VEOG above left eye | VEOG below left eye | VEOG above right eye | VEOG below right eye | left HEOG | right HEOG | an electrode used to make balanced noncephalic reference | other
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: the visibility of this question is now dependent on the previous question 7.9.2023 Angela: removed "electrodes" from "other electrodes" in case it could create future problems with automatic changes to all "other" options

question: Which electrodes were used in addition to the ones described above?
Make (brand) of the amplifier
Make (brand) of the amplifiers other than listed above
Model of amplifiers
Source of triggers
choices: photo diode | auditory trigger/voice key | combination stim tracker | presentation software trigger | other

question: Source of triggers other than listed.
Do you wish to describe triggers in more detail?
details: This information is not required by the guidelines for good EEG reporting practice by Keil et al. (2014), but it might interest a reader.
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: new question to simplify the form by hiding some questions that are not required by any guidelines for good practice, in line with a reviewer's suggestion that it is not neccessary to go this much into detail with triggers  27.11.2023 Angela: corrected to radio and it was radio_multiple by mistake

question: Describe trigger signal input. Were triggers delivered during acquisition (e.g., triggers from photo diode simultaneously recorded while presenting trials) or added after recording (e.g. after analysis of an audio recording of spoken responses)?
choices: Online, during acquisition | Added after recording
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: visibility changed to make this question practically optional

question: Where where the trigger signals acquired?
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: visibility changed to make this question practically optional

question: How were tigger signals aquired?
choices: Analogue (e.g., via a parallel port, serial port, or TCP/IP) | Digital (including serial port over a USB port (arduino, LabJack U3, or similar))
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: visibility changed to make this question practically optional

question: Was any other equipment used during acquisition?
details: You can list here any special equipment that you find necessary to report, such as (1) special monitors, keyboards, etc. worth mentioning; (2) additional EEG recording equipment such as AD converters or electrode position measurement devices; (3) other recording equipment used in parallel, such as eye tracking, fMRI, electrodermal or heart rate monitors.

question: Describe which additional devices were used, and specify their manufacturers and models.
